projects.title: Toronto Crime Dashboard
projects.bodyText:
- Interactive Map: The dashboard features an interactive map of Toronto, allowing users to visualize crime incidents across various neighborhoods.
 - Crime Filtering: Users can filter crime data based on different crime types, dates, and locations, enabling them to focus on specific areas of interest.  
 - Time-Series Analysis: The dashboard includes time-series analysis capabilities, enabling users to observe trends and patterns in crime incidents over time. 
 - Data Visualization: The project utilizes D3.js and Leaflet.js to create visually appealing charts and maps that effectively represent crime data.

projects.title: Machine Learning Churn Prediction Web App
projects.bodyText:
- Model Prediction: Predict customer churn in a telecommunications company.
 - User Input: Input customer attributes for churn prediction.
 - Data Preprocessing: Handle missing values, encode categorical variables, and scale numerical features.
 - SHAP Analysis: Analyze factors influencing the prediction using SHAP values.
 - Web Interface: Intuitive interface with user-friendly input fields and interactive visualization.
 - Real-time Results: Instantly view prediction and SHAP force plot.

projects.title: Toronto Crime Analysis Report
projects.bodyText:
- Data Preparation: Cleaned and transformed raw crime data using Python and Pandas to make it suitable for analysis.
 - General Overview: Created an initial page providing a high-level overview of crime in Toronto neighborhoods.
 - Detailed Exploration: Developed interactive dashboards allowing users to explore specific neighborhoods by year, crime type, premise type, and days of the week.
 - Spatial Analysis: Incorporated a map visualization to display the geographical distribution of crimes in Toronto.
 - Decomposition Tree: Utilized a decomposition tree to analyze crime data by type, premise, day, and hour.
 - Neighborhood Insights: Included a separate table that dynamically updates based on decomposition tree selections, showing the incident count in individual neighborhoods.

projects.title: Bellabeat Case Study
projects.bodyText:
- Data Preprocessing: Employ R and tidyverse to clean, format, and merge the Fitbit data from various sources for further analysis.
 - Exploratory Data Analysis: Conduct a comprehensive exploration of the daily activity, hourly intensity, and step data to discover trends, patterns, and valuable insights.
 - Usage Patterns: Calculate and visualize the percentage of time users wore the Fitbit device, categorizing them into different usage groups.
 - Hourly Trends: Create insightful visualizations of the average daily steps on different days of the week to identify any significant patterns in activity levels.
 - Intensity Analysis: Investigate the different intensity levels recorded by the Fitbit device and analyze their distribution across users and time.

projects.title: Citibike Ride Analysis
projects.bodyText:
- Data Preparation: Use Pandas to format and combine data from multiple years.
 - Hourly, Daily, and Monthly Trends: Visualize popularity of start and end stations by hour, day, and month.
 - Bar Graphs and Maps: Represent data in bar graphs and maps for easy interpretation.
 - Tableau Homepage: Create a navigation-friendly homepage to easily switch between visualizations.
